title: Replicating analysis from the NCHS data brief, 2017
text: tests, include cohort CDC report. Full details inclusion criteria given paper. cases, use nhanes_summarize() nhanes_visualize() generating results cardioStatsUSA. , use nhanes_design family functions. NHANES design functions lower level functions support nhanes_summarize nhanes_visualize. Full details family can found help page [nhanes_design]. create separate NHANES design object use age adjustment via direct standardization, copying standard weights reported CDC first test: sample size CDC report?
code: nhanes_data_test <- nhanes_data_test %>%  # exclude pregnant women  .[demo_pregnant == 'No' | is.na(demo_pregnant)] %>%  # exclude participants missing both SBP and DBP  .[!(is.na(bp_dia_mean) & is.na(bp_sys_mean))] ds <- nhanes_data_test %>%  nhanes_design(   key = nhanes_key,   outcome_variable = 'htn_jnc7',   group_variable = 'demo_age_cat',   time_values = '2015-2016'  ) ds_standard <- ds %>%  nhanes_design_standardize(   standard_variable = 'demo_age_cat',   standard_weights = c(0.420263, 0.357202, 0.222535)  ) expect_equal(  5504, # this is the sample size reported by CDC  nrow(ds$design$variables) )

title: Replicating analysis from the NCHS data brief, 2017
text: test compares answers versus Figure 1 CDC report. begin loading data Figure 1: Now summarize design object (ds) various updates create results age group sex within age groups Putting answers together: Putting everything together: Now can formally check equality:
code: test_data <- cdc_db289_figure_1 %>%  setnames(old = c('estimate', 'std_error'),           new = c('cdc_estimate', 'cdc_std_error')) shiny_answers_by_age <- ds %>%  nhanes_design_summarize(outcome_stats = 'percentage',                          simplify_output = TRUE) %>%  .[htn_jnc7 == 'Yes'] %>%  .[, demo_gender := 'Overall']  shiny_answers_by_age_sex <- ds %>%  # this adds a stratify variable to the already existing group variable (age)  # to make results stratified by age and sex groups.  nhanes_design_update(stratify_variable = 'demo_gender') %>%  nhanes_design_summarize(outcome_stats = 'percentage',                          simplify_output = TRUE) %>%  .[htn_jnc7 == 'Yes'] shiny_answers <- list(shiny_answers_by_age,                       shiny_answers_by_age_sex) %>%  rbindlist(use.names = TRUE) %>%  .[, .(demo_gender,        demo_age_cat,        shiny_estimate = round(estimate,1),        shiny_std_error = round(std_error,1))] test_results <- test_data %>%  merge(shiny_answers, by = c("demo_gender", "demo_age_cat"))  test_results #>    demo_gender demo_age_cat cdc_estimate cdc_std_error shiny_estimate #> 1:         Men        18-39          9.2           1.4            9.2 #> 2:         Men        40-59         37.2           2.9           37.2 #> 3:         Men          60+         58.5           2.2           58.5 #> 4:     Overall        18-39          7.5           1.0            7.5 #> 5:     Overall        40-59         33.2           1.7           33.2 #> 6:     Overall          60+         63.1           2.1           63.1 #> 7:       Women        18-39          5.6           1.1            5.6 #> 8:       Women        40-59         29.4           2.0           29.4 #> 9:       Women          60+         66.8           2.6           66.8 #>    shiny_std_error #> 1:             1.4 #> 2:             2.9 #> 3:             2.2 #> 4:             1.0 #> 5:             1.7 #> 6:             2.1 #> 7:             1.1 #> 8:             2.0 #> 9:             2.6 test_that(  'cardioStatsUSA matches CDC report, Figure 1',  code = {    expect_equal(test_results$cdc_estimate,                test_results$shiny_estimate)    expect_equal(test_results$cdc_std_error,                test_results$shiny_std_error)   } ) #> Test passed 😀

This is based on the average of up to 3 readings. Participants were required to have at least one reading. Overall, >95% of participants with at least one systolic blood pressure reading had three readings.  From 1999-2000 through 2015-2016, systolic blood pressure was measured using a mercury sphygmomanometer.  In 2017-2020, systolic blood pressure was measured using an oscillometric device. what: Survey Design for NHANES Data — nhanes_design
title: Survey Design for NHANES Data — nhanes_design
text: NHANES design objects data structure used cardioStatsUSA package analysis NHANES data.

title: Survey Design for NHANES Data — nhanes_design
code: nhanes_design(   data,   key,   outcome_variable,   outcome_quantiles = NULL,   group_variable = NULL,   group_cut_n = NULL,   group_cut_type = NULL,   stratify_variable = NULL,   time_variable = "svy_year",   time_values = NULL,   pool = FALSE,   run_checks = TRUE )

title: Survey Design for NHANES Data — nhanes_design
text: data [data.frame] set NHANES data one row per survey participant one column per variable. See nhanes_data details See Details specific requirements. See nhanes_data example. key [data.frame] data set one row per variable columns describe variable. See nhanes_key details See Details specific requirements. See nhanes_key example. outcome_variable [character(1)] name outcome variable summarized. outcome_quantiles [numeric(1+)] quantiles summarized continuous outcome. default c(0.25, 0.50, 0.75). example, outcome_quantiles = c(.5) compute 50th percentile (.e., median) outcome_quantiles = c(.25, .5, .75) compute 25th, 50th, 75th percentile. outcome_quantiles = seq(.1, .9, = .1) compute every 10th percentile, except 0th 100th group_variable [character(1)] name group variable. See Details description group variable stratify variable. group_cut_n [integer(1)] number groups form using group variable. relevant group variable continuous, can omitted. Default 3 group_cut_type [character(1)] method used create groups grouping variable. relevant fthe group variable continuous, can omitted. Valid options : "interval": equal interval width, e.g., three groups ages 0 <10, 10 <20, 20 < 30 years. "frequency": equal frequency, e.g., three groups ages 0 <q, q <p, p <r, q, p, r selected roughly number people group. stratify_variable [character(1)] name stratify variable. See Details description group variable stratify variable. time_variable [character(1)] name time variable. default, svy_year, corresponds variable nhanes_data indicates 2 year NHANES cycle observation collected . time_values [character(1+)] time values included design object. default include time values present data. Valid options : 'most_recent': includes recent time value. 'last_5': includes 5 recent time values. '': includes time values present data. can also give vector specific time values, e.g., c("2009-2010", "2011-2012", "2013-2014"), values present time_variable column (nhanes_data). pool [logical(1)] FALSE (default), results presented individual times, separately. TRUE, data time value pooled together. Note contiguous cycles pooled together, e.g., using pool = TRUE time_values = 'last_5' okay, using pool = TRUE time_values = c("2009-2010", "2013-2014") recommended (strange result interpret). run_checks [logical(1)] TRUE (default), inputs checked validity. FALSE, checks inputs skipped.

title: Survey Design for NHANES Data — nhanes_design
code: library(cardioStatsUSA)  ds <- nhanes_design(data = nhanes_data,                     key = nhanes_key,                      time_values = 'most_recent',                     outcome_variable = 'bp_sys_mean')  print(ds) ## ------------------------- NHANES design ------------------------- ##  ## Outcome variable: bp_sys_mean ## - label: Systolic blood pressure (SBP), mm Hg ## - type: continuous ## - description: Mean systolic blood pressure in mm Hg. This is ##     based on the average of up to 3 readings. Participants were ##     required to have at least one reading. Overall, >95% of ##     participants with at least one systolic blood pressure reading ##     had three readings.  From 1999-2000 through 2015-2016, systolic ##     blood pressure was measured using a mercury sphygmomanometer.  In ##     2017-2020, systolic blood pressure was measured using an ##     oscillometric device.  The systolic blood pressure in 2017-2020 ##     was calibrated to the mercury device by adding 1.5 mm Hg to the ##     mean measured oscillometric value. ##  ## Group variable: None ## Stratify variable: None ##  ## N observations ## - Unweighted: 8,965 ## - Weighted: 247,835,696 ## ------------------------------------------------------------------

code: nhanes_design_subset(ds_men, demo_age_years > 40) ## Error in nhanes_design_subset(ds_men, demo_age_years > 40): NHANES design has already been subsetted. To ensure the expected result occurs when subsetting, NHANES design objects can only be subsetted once. This is enforced so that nhanes_design_update() works as intended. If you need to add more conditions to your subset, you can do subset(A & B) instead of subset(A) and subset(B)

title: Modify an NHANES design — nhanes_design_update
text: ways design can updated. example, can add group variable:     Pipes multiple modifications allowed:
code: library(cardioStatsUSA)  ds <- nhanes_design(data = nhanes_data,                     key = nhanes_key,                      time_values = 'most_recent',                     outcome_variable = 'bp_sys_mean')  print(ds) ## ------------------------- NHANES design ------------------------- ##  ## Outcome variable: bp_sys_mean ## - label: Systolic blood pressure (SBP), mm Hg ## - type: continuous ## - description: Mean systolic blood pressure in mm Hg. This is ##     based on the average of up to 3 readings. Participants were ##     required to have at least one reading. Overall, >95% of ##     participants with at least one systolic blood pressure reading ##     had three readings.  From 1999-2000 through 2015-2016, systolic ##     blood pressure was measured using a mercury sphygmomanometer.  In ##     2017-2020, systolic blood pressure was measured using an ##     oscillometric device.  The systolic blood pressure in 2017-2020 ##     was calibrated to the mercury device by adding 1.5 mm Hg to the ##     mean measured oscillometric value. ##  ## Group variable: None ## Stratify variable: None ##  ## N observations ## - Unweighted: 8,965 ## - Weighted: 247,835,696 ## ------------------------------------------------------------------ nhanes_design_update(ds, group_variable = 'demo_gender') ## ------------------------- NHANES design ------------------------- ##  ## Outcome variable: bp_sys_mean ## - label: Systolic blood pressure (SBP), mm Hg ## - type: continuous ## - description: Mean systolic blood pressure in mm Hg. This is ##     based on the average of up to 3 readings. Participants were ##     required to have at least one reading. Overall, >95% of ##     participants with at least one systolic blood pressure reading ##     had three readings.  From 1999-2000 through 2015-2016, systolic ##     blood pressure was measured using a mercury sphygmomanometer.  In ##     2017-2020, systolic blood pressure was measured using an ##     oscillometric device.  The systolic blood pressure in 2017-2020 ##     was calibrated to the mercury device by adding 1.5 mm Hg to the ##     mean measured oscillometric value. ##  ## Group variable: demo_gender ## - label: Gender ## - type: categorical ## - description: Self-reported gender ##  ## Stratify variable: None ##  ## N observations ## - Unweighted: 8,965 ## - Weighted: 247,835,696 ## ------------------------------------------------------------------ ds %>%   nhanes_design_update(group_variable = 'demo_gender',                       stratify_variable = 'demo_race') ## ------------------------- NHANES design ------------------------- ##  ## Outcome variable: bp_sys_mean ## - label: Systolic blood pressure (SBP), mm Hg ## - type: continuous ## - description: Mean systolic blood pressure in mm Hg. This is ##     based on the average of up to 3 readings. Participants were ##     required to have at least one reading. Overall, >95% of ##     participants with at least one systolic blood pressure reading ##     had three readings.  From 1999-2000 through 2015-2016, systolic ##     blood pressure was measured using a mercury sphygmomanometer.  In ##     2017-2020, systolic blood pressure was measured using an ##     oscillometric device.  The systolic blood pressure in 2017-2020 ##     was calibrated to the mercury device by adding 1.5 mm Hg to the ##     mean measured oscillometric value. ##  ## Group variable: demo_gender ## - label: Gender ## - type: categorical ## - description: Self-reported gender ##  ## Stratify variable: demo_race ## - label: Race ## - type: categorical ## - description: Self-reported race/ethnicity. From 1999-2000 ##     through 2009-2010 this was available as non-Hispanic White, ##     non-Hispanic Black, Hispanic and other. From 2011-2012 through ##     2017-2020 this was available as non-Hispanic White, non-Hispanic ##     Black, non-Hispanic Asian, Hispanic and other. ##  ## N observations ## - Unweighted: 8,965 ## - Weighted: 247,835,696 ## ------------------------------------------------------------------

title: Generate summaries of NHANES — nhanes_summarize
text: data [data.frame] set NHANES data one row per survey participant one column per variable. See nhanes_data details See Details specific requirements. See nhanes_data example. key [data.frame] data set one row per variable columns describe variable. See nhanes_key details See Details specific requirements. See nhanes_key example. outcome_variable [character(1)] name outcome variable summarized. outcome_quantiles [numeric(1+)] quantiles summarized continuous outcome. default c(0.25, 0.50, 0.75). example, outcome_quantiles = c(.5) compute 50th percentile (.e., median) outcome_quantiles = c(.25, .5, .75) compute 25th, 50th, 75th percentile. outcome_quantiles = seq(.1, .9, = .1) compute every 10th percentile, except 0th 100th outcome_stats [character(1+)] statistics computed. Multiple statistics may requested. Valid options depend type outcome summarized. continuous outcomes, valid options include 'mean': estimates mean value outcome 'quantile': estimates 25th, 50th, 75th percentile outcome. categorical outcomes, valid options include 'percentage': estimates prevalence outcome 'percentage_kg': estimates prevalence uses Korn Graubard's method estimate 95% confidence interval 'count': estimates number US adults outcome. group_variable [character(1)] name group variable. See Details description group variable stratify variable. group_cut_n [integer(1)] number groups form using group variable. relevant group variable continuous, can omitted. Default 3 group_cut_type [character(1)] method used create groups grouping variable. relevant fthe group variable continuous, can omitted. Valid options : "interval": equal interval width, e.g., three groups ages 0 <10, 10 <20, 20 < 30 years. "frequency": equal frequency, e.g., three groups ages 0 <q, q <p, p <r, q, p, r selected roughly number people group. stratify_variable [character(1)] name stratify variable. See Details description group variable stratify variable. time_variable [character(1)] name time variable. default, svy_year, corresponds variable nhanes_data indicates 2 year NHANES cycle observation collected . time_values [character(1+)] time values included design object. default include time values present data. Valid options : 'most_recent': includes recent time value. 'last_5': includes 5 recent time values. '': includes time values present data. can also give vector specific time values, e.g., c("2009-2010", "2011-2012", "2013-2014"), values present time_variable column (nhanes_data). pool [logical(1)] FALSE (default), results presented individual times, separately. TRUE, data time value pooled together. Note contiguous cycles pooled together, e.g., using pool = TRUE time_values = 'last_5' okay, using pool = TRUE time_values = c("2009-2010", "2013-2014") recommended (strange result interpret). subset_calls [named list(n)] names subset_calls variable names, values values variable include subsetted data. example, subset_calls = list("demo_gender" = "Women") subset data include rows demo_gender equal "Women". Multiple entries allowed collapsed logical & operator. example, subset_calls = list(demo_gender = "Women", bp_med_use = "Yes") subset data include rows demo_gender equal 'Women' bp_med_use equal "Yes" standard_variable [character(1)] name variable used create standardization groups. default use demo_age_cat, leads age standardization. standard_weights [numeric(n)] proportionate weights group defined standard variable. number weights equal number groups defined standard_variable weights must >0. simplify_output [logical(1)] type output returned nhanes_design simplify_output FALSE data.table otherwise.
